[Home](./index.md) &gt; [@gnaudio/jabra-js](./jabra-js.md) &gt; [EasyCallControlFactory](./jabra-js.easycallcontrolfactory.md) &gt; [createMultiCallControl](./jabra-js.easycallcontrolfactory.createmulticallcontrol.md)

## EasyCallControlFactory.createMultiCallControl() method

Creates a [IMultiCallControl](./jabra-js.imulticallcontrol.md) instance for a given device, enabling multi-call-control functionality.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
createMultiCallControl(device: IDevice, initialState?: IMultiInitialState): Promise<IMultiCallControl>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  device | [IDevice](./jabra-js.idevice.md) | an SDK device from which the call-control device will be constructed. |
|  initialState | [IMultiInitialState](./jabra-js.imultiinitialstate.md) | <i>(Optional)</i> An optional parameter, which sets the initial state of the created object. Use it when handling device changes. |

<b>Returns:</b>

Promise&lt;[IMultiCallControl](./jabra-js.imulticallcontrol.md)<!-- -->&gt;

a Promise which emits a new [IMultiCallControl](./jabra-js.imulticallcontrol.md)<!-- -->.

## Remarks

This includes APIs for setting a device on hold and handle multiple ongoing calls.

If you do not need to handle multiple ongoing calls, we advise you to use the SingleCallControl interface instead - see method `createSingleCallControl`
